meanings.definition: A person or group that uses force or coercion to achieve a goal.
meanings.sent1: The forcible enforcer demanded compliance from the group.
meanings.sent2: The police were the forcible enforcers of the law in the city.
meanings.sent3: The strict teacher was jokingly called the homework enforcer by the students.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a powerful enforcer in reaching her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The image of a lion is a strong enforcer of courage in many cultures.

meanings.definition: A tool or device used to apply force or pressure.
meanings.sent1: He used a hammer as the forceful enforcer to nail the boards together.
meanings.sent2: The hydraulic press was a reliable enforcer in shaping the metal.
meanings.sent3: The vacuum cleaner was the dust enforcer in the house.
meanings.sent4: The ruler acted as a strict enforcer of straight lines in drawing.
meanings.sent5: The wind became a natural enforcer of movement in the trees.

meanings.definition: A sports team or player known for their physical strength and aggressive play.
meanings.sent1: The football team was the strong enforcer on the field.
meanings.sent2: The boxer was a fierce enforcer in the ring.
meanings.sent3: The wrestler was jokingly called the mat enforcer by his friends.
meanings.sent4: The basketball player was a towering enforcer under the hoop.
meanings.sent5: The image of a rhinoceros is a powerful enforcer of toughness in nature.
